      • calculateHeapSize

        public static int calculateHeapSize(int memory)
        Calculate the heap size for the JVMs to start in the containers. Since JVMs are allocating more than just the heap space, and YARN is very fast at killing processes that use memory beyond their limit, we have to come up with a good heapsize. This code takes 85% of the given amount of memory (in MB). If the amount we removed by these 85% more than 500MB (the current HEAP_LIMIT_CAP), we'll just subtract 500 MB.

      • offsetPort

        public static int offsetPort(int port,
             int appId)
        Valid ports are 1024 - 65535. We offset the incoming port by the applicationId to avoid port collisions if YARN allocates two ApplicationMasters on the same physical hardware
